...the Maestro Hook is a small conversation piece that you can use with foreigners...
In America, when you get a present, you open it in front of the person.
If it's food, you even eat it.
Of course in Japan, when you get a present, you don't open it and you take it home,...
...and you open it later, and thank them later.
There's a little bit of difference there.
For example, when you get a present in America,...
"Oh! This is food. I'm gonna try it."
"Oh! You shouldn't have. I'm so sorry, thank you!"
